H0.text: Lung capacity is increased is the way a louder cry helps to ensure survival for young birds within the same nest, as observed by scientists.

H1.text: Exposure to bacteria is increased, which describes how a louder cry helps ensure survival for some young birds even within the same nest.

H2.text: Parents are able to identify the nest when some young birds call louder than others within the same nest, helping to ensure their survival.

H3.text: Parents respond by giving more food, which ensures the survival of young birds that cry louder, as scientists have observed within the same nest.

A4.text: identification of other individuals (such as when parents look for chicks in colonies or when mates reunite at the start of breeding season)
